com.ibm.icu.util
Class AnnualTimeZoneRule

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.icu.util.TimeZoneRule
      com.ibm.icu.util.AnnualTimeZoneRule

public class AnnualTimeZoneRule
extends TimeZoneRule

AnnualTimeZoneRule is a class used for representing a time zone rule which takes effect annually. Years used in this class are all Gregorian calendar years.

Field Summary
static int MAX_YEAR
          The constant representing the maximum year used for designating a rule is permanent.
 
Constructor Summary
AnnualTimeZoneRule(java.lang.String name, int stdOffset, int dstSaving, AnnualDateTimeRule dateTimeRule, int startYear, int endYear)
          Constructs a TimeZoneRule with the name, the GMT offset of its standard time, the amount of daylight saving offset adjustment, the annual start time rule and the start/until years.

Field Detail

MAX_YEAR

public static final int MAX_YEAR
The constant representing the maximum year used for designating a rule is permanent.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

AnnualTimeZoneRule

public AnnualTimeZoneRule(java.lang.String name,
                          int stdOffset,
                          int dstSaving,
                          AnnualDateTimeRule dateTimeRule,
                          int startYear,
                          int endYear)
Constructs a TimeZoneRule with the name, the GMT offset of its standard time, the amount of daylight saving offset adjustment, the annual start time rule and the start/until years.

Parameters:
name - The time zone name.
stdOffset - The GMT offset of its standard time in milliseconds.
dstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset adjustment in milliseconds. If this ia a rule for standard time, the value of this argument is 0.
dateTimeRule - The start date/time rule repeated annually.
startYear - The first year when this rule takes effect.
endYear - The last year when this rule takes effect. If this rule is effective forever in future, specify MAX_YEAR.
Method Detail

getRule

public AnnualDateTimeRule getRule()
Gets the start date/time rule associated used by this rule.

Returns:
An AnnualDateTimeRule which represents the start date/time rule used by this time zone rule.

getStartYear

public int getStartYear()
Gets the first year when this rule takes effect.

Returns:
The start year of this rule. The year is in Gregorian calendar with 0 == 1 BCE, -1 == 2 BCE, etc.

getEndYear

public int getEndYear()
Gets the end year when this rule takes effect.

Returns:
The end year of this rule (inclusive). The year is in Gregorian calendar with 0 == 1 BCE, -1 == 2 BCE, etc.

getStartInYear

public java.util.Date getStartInYear(int year,
                                     int prevStdOffset,
                                     int prevDstSaving)
Gets the time when this rule takes effect in the given year.

Parameters:
year - The Gregorian year, with 0 == 1 BCE, -1 == 2 BCE, etc.
prevStdOffset - The offset from UTC before this rule takes effect in milliseconds.
prevDstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset from the standard time.
Returns:
The time when this rule takes effect in the year, or null if this rule is not applicable in the year.

getFirstStart

public java.util.Date getFirstStart(int prevStdOffset,
                                    int prevDstSaving)
Gets the very first time when this rule takes effect.

Parameters:
prevStdOffset - The offset from UTC before this rule takes effect in milliseconds.
prevDstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset from the standard time.
Returns:
The very first time when this rule takes effect.

getFinalStart

public java.util.Date getFinalStart(int prevStdOffset,
                                    int prevDstSaving)
Gets the final time when this rule takes effect.

Parameters:
prevStdOffset - The offset from UTC before this rule takes effect in milliseconds.
prevDstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset from the standard time.
Returns:
The very last time when this rule takes effect, or null if this rule is applied for future dates infinitely.

getNextStart

public java.util.Date getNextStart(long base,
                                   int prevStdOffset,
                                   int prevDstSaving,
                                   boolean inclusive)
Gets the first time when this rule takes effect after the specified time.

Parameters:
base - The first time after this time is returned.
prevStdOffset - The offset from UTC before this rule takes effect in milliseconds.
prevDstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset from the standard time.
inclusive - Whether the base time is inclusive or not.
Returns:
The first time when this rule takes effect after the specified time, or null when this rule never takes effect after the specified time.

getLastStart

public java.util.Date getLastStart(long base,
                                   int prevStdOffset,
                                   int prevDstSaving,
                                   boolean inclusive)
Gets the last time when this rule takes effect before the specified time.

Parameters:
base - The last time before this time is returned.
prevStdOffset - The offset from UTC before this rule takes effect in milliseconds.
prevDstSaving - The amount of daylight saving offset from the standard time.
inclusive - Whether the base time is inclusive or not.
Returns:
The first time when this rule takes effect after the specified time, or null when this rule never takes effect after the specified time.
